title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9760.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 9760.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

The following terms shall have the following meanings, unless the context shall indicate another or different meaning or
intent: (a) Corporation means the New

York Local Government Assistance Corporation created by title 4 of article 10-B
of the Public Authorities Law. (b) Record means any information kept, held, filed, produced or reproduced by, with
or for the corporation, in any physical form whatsoever including, but not
limited to, reports, statements, examinations, memoranda, opinions, folders, files, books, manuals, pamphlets, forms, papers, designs, drawings, maps, photos, letters, microfilms, computer tapes or discs, rules, regulations or
codes. (c) Records access officer
means the secretary of the corporation or the duly designated representative of
the Secretary. (d) Records appeals
officer means the duly designated representative of the directors of the
corporation authorized to hear and determine appeals from denials of access to
records. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
9760.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
